    • Method Detail

      • retrieveResourceDirectory

        public java.lang.String retrieveResourceDirectory(ResourceCore image,
                                                  java.lang.String guessDir)
        If guessDir is neither null nor "default", and the directory guessDir exists, then guessDir is used. If that fails or guessDir is "default" or null, an attempt is made to retrieve the last used directory in ImageJ. If that also fails, null is returned.
        Specified by:
        retrieveResourceDirectory in class FileHelper
        Parameters:
        image - An image assumed to be opened in ImageJ
        guessDir - if equals "defaultDir" returns the default directory if equals "lastDir" and a last directory is defined returns the last directory if existing directory, then return guessDir In all other cases return the last directory
        Returns:
        a directory that might be null.

      • getMacroDir

        public static java.lang.String getMacroDir()
        Returns:
        The default directory for ImageJ macros

      • retrieveLastDirectory

        public java.lang.String retrieveLastDirectory(java.lang.String guessDir)
        Description copied from class: FileHelper
        Checks is the input directory path does correspond to a directory. Attempts to retrieve the last used directory from the framework, or a default directory is that fails too.
        Specified by:
        retrieveLastDirectory in class FileHelper
        Parameters:
        guessDir - If guessDir is neither null nor "default", and the directory guessDir exists, then guessDir is used. If guessDir is "default", then an attempt is made to obtain the image directory from metadata. If that fails or guessDir is null, an attempt is made to retrieve the last used directory in the framework. If that also fails, null is returned.
        Returns:
        a directory that might be null.
        See Also:
        FileHelper.retrieveLastDirectory(java.lang.String)
